headline: GE HealthCare announces 510(k) submission for CleaRecon DL technology designed to improve image quality in the interventional suite with AI-based reconstruction
summary: CHICAGO, December 03, 2024--GE HealthCare (Nasdaq: GEHC) announced today the 510(k) submission to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for CleaRecon DL, deep learning technology, designed to improve the quality of cone-beam computed tomography (CBCT) images by bringing artificial intelligence (AI)-based 3D reconstruction to the interventional suite. This technology, which is pending 510(k) clearance, will be demonstrated at the Radiological Society of North America’s (RSNA) 2024 Annual Meeting

headline: GE HealthCare: CleaRecon DL submitted for FDA approval
summary: GE HealthCare announces that it has submitted an application to the FDA to market CleaRecon DL, a deep learning technology aimed at improving the quality of cone-beam computed tomography images...
